Posts.Content: Bridget1 wrote: I have recently been advised I need to get a biopsy due to mammogram finding two clusters of microcalcifications.  I have received conflicting advise on what type of biopsy to get.  My PCP (whom I trust implicitly) advised for surgical as did my sister who is a breast cancer survivor.  The surgeon I went to and the radiologist recommended needle.  I have a very strong family history of breast cancer - numerous cousins have had it, all were diagnosed before age 40 and they are also giving me conflicting advice, some for needle, some for surgical. My sister was diagnosed in her late 40's.  I am 56.  I would appreciate some advice from those who have gone through this.....which biopsy?? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: biopsy; needle v surgical? Bridget1 beepbeep

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2011 06:58PM Bridget1 wrote: As I said, not sure except my pcp said surgical would get most accurate results and they would be able to remove all of calcification when doing biopsy....don't know if that is strictly considered lumpectomy.  Sister recommended because she said needle was extremely painful and "would never, ever do again!". Cousins say not so painful but would rather be sure all out.
